IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE HIGHER EDUCATION TO COLLEGE STUDENTS
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING WHICH PROVIDES INSTRUCTION IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AND SCIENCES AND CONFERS DEGREES UPON THE COMPLETION OF CURRICULA PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS CHARTER AND THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION, LIBRARY, AND STUDENT AID OF APPROXIMATELY 1,500 COLLEGE STUDENTS BY APPROXIMATELY 120 QUALIFIED INSTRUCTORS AND THE OPERATION OF THE PHYSICAL PLANT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: STUDENT SERVICES AND AUXILIARY (STUDENT SUPPORT) SERVICES CONSISTING OF HOUSING, FOOD SERVICE, LAUNDRY SERVICE, INFIRMARY AND COUNSELING OF APPROXIMATELY 1,500 COLLEGE STUDENTS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LAURI STRIMKOVSKY VP FOR FINANCE AND ADMIN

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: DEAN OF THE TAGLIATELA SCHOOL OF BUSINESS LEADERSH

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALBERTUS MAGNUS COLLEGE MAY INDIRECTLY INCUR LOBBYING EXPENSES THROUGH DUES PAID TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE COLLEGE AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT, AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COLLEGE'S FEDERAL INFORMATION RETURNS PRIOR TO FISCAL YEAR 2020 ARE CLOSED AND MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY EVALUATES EXPIRING STATUES OF LIMITATION, AUDITS, PROPOSED SETTLEMENT, CHANGES IN TAX LAW AND NEW AUTHORITATIVE RULINGS. IF THE COLLEGE HAD UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES, IT WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY TAX MATTERS AS PART OF INCOME TAX PROVISION AND INCLUDED ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES WITH THE RELATED TAX LIABILITY IN THE STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION.
INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT AID 12,710,968. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES -83,660. TUITION DISCOUNT 1,753,330.

THE COLLEGE HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT AND SPENDING POLICIES FOR ENDOWMENT ASSETS THAT ATTEMPT TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY ITS ENDOWMENT WHILE SEEKING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.
NOTED IN GENERAL PUBLICATIONS AND ADVERTISEMENTS.
SCHEDULE E - LINE 6A: THE COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: REDUCTION OF TUITION COST CHARGED TO STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH STUDENTS IN COMPLETING THE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO ADJUSTMENT BASED ON CHANGES IN ENROLLMENT, CHANGES IN HOUSING STATUS, CHANGES IN NEED, NEED ANALYSIS, FAILURE TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CONFLICTING INFORMATION ON THE STUDENT LOAN DATA SYSTEM. REVISIONS ARE MADE IN A TIMELY MANNER WHEN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS NOTIFIED OF A CHANGE IN ELIGIBILITY.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: DEAN OF THE TAGLIATELA SCHOOL OF BUS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PAYMENTS MADE FOR HOUSING ALLOWANCE ARE STIPULATED IN THE EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT AND INCLUDED IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN (B)(III).
BONUSES ARE PAID TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON PERFORMANCE METRICS. BONUS AMOUNTS ARE INCLUDED IN PART II, COLUMN B(II).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT, VP FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, AND FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO PROVIDING A COPY TO THE FULL BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW. ONCE APPROVED BY THE BOARD, FORM 990 IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE RETURN OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS WHICH MUST BE SIGNED ANNUALLY BY ALL OFFICERS, TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES. ANY DISCLOSED CONFLICT IS REPORTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, ACTING AS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, OVERSEES, REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL COMPENSATION ON AN ANNUAL BASIS WITH THE ADVICE OF A COMPENSATION CONSULTANT, USING COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTS THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE MAKES ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
